H0.text: 0.7 g is the mass of oxygen produced when 10 g of mercuric oxide is heated to yield 9.3 g of liquid mercury.

H1.text: 9.3 g is the number of grams of oxygen formed when a scientist heated 10 g of mercuric oxide and produced 9.3 g of liquid mercury.

H2.text: 10.0 g is the mass of oxygen produced when 10.0 g of mercuric oxide is heated and 9.3 g of liquid mercury forms.

H3.text: 19.3 g is the mass of oxygen formed when a scientist heated 10 g of mercuric oxide and obtained 9.3 g of liquid mercury.

A4.text: When mercury oxide decomposes, oxygen gas is generated.
